page.title: 02Farming
page.content: Much of this area is covered by dense plantations of mixed conifers grown commercially by Forbes Estate in the west and the Forestry Commission to the east. When the trees are felled on maturity re-planting programmes are carried out to ensure continuity. In the summer and autumn of 1985 Forbes Estate sold standing timber for felling in Black Knap plantation (approx. 6500 trees). These had been planted between 1919 and 1923 and consisted mainly of Norwegian ans Sitka Spruce with some Scots Pine, Japanese Larch and Douglas Fir. The heavy rainfall during the summer months caused difficulty in extracting the felled timber with heavy vehicles becoming stuck fast in the muddy forest roads.
